text: Frank Heaney (23 November 1886 – 24 August 1937) was an Irish amateur football right back who played in the Football League for Leeds City. He was a member of the Irish Free State squad for the 1924 Summer OIympics, but did not travel to the tournament. == Personal life == Heaney served in the Irish Guards during the First World War. He died of stomach cancer in 1937. == Honours == St James's Gate * League of Ireland (1): 1921–22 * FAI Cup (1): 1921–22 * Irish Intermediate Cup (1): 1919–20 * Leinster Senior League (1): 1919–20 * Leinster Senior Cup (2): 1919–20, 1921–22 * LFA Metropolitan Cup (1): 1919–20 == Career statistics == {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center;" |+ Appearances and goals by club, season and competition ! rowspan="2" |Club ! rowspan="2" |Season ! colspan="3" |League ! colspan="2" |National Cup ! colspan="2" |Total |- !Division !Apps !Goals !Apps !Goals !Apps !Goals |- |Leeds City |1911–12 |Second Division |2 |0 |0 |0 |2 |0 |- ! colspan="3" |Career total !2 !0 !0 !0 !2 !0 |} ==References== Category:Irish association footballers (before 1923) Category:NIFL Premiership players Category:Association football fullbacks Category:St James's Gate F.C. players Category:English Football League players Category:Leeds City F.C. players Category:Northern Ireland amateur international footballers Category:Shelbourne F.C. players Category:Sportspeople from Dublin (city) Category:1886 births Category:1937 deaths Category:British Army personnel of World War I Category:Irish Guards soldiers Category:Deaths from stomach cancer Category:Olympic footballers of Ireland Category:Footballers at the 1924 Summer Olympics Category:Deaths from cancer in the Republic of Ireland
title: Frank Heaney
